jMusicMetaManager
Class RecordingMetaData

java.lang.Object
  jMusicMetaManager.RecordingMetaData
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class RecordingMetaData
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

An object to hold the metadata associated with an MP3 recording that has been added to a music collection. Includes methods for extracting this information from an Apple iTunes XML file or from an MP3's ID3 tags, as well as performing additional processing.

String and Date entries are set to null if the information is not available and empty entries in the genre array are remeoved. Numerical entris are set to -1 if the information corresponding to the tag is unknown.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

file_path

public java.lang.String file_path
The file path of the recording referred to.

title

public java.lang.String title
The title of the recording.

artist

public java.lang.String artist
The performer(s) of the recording.

composer

public java.lang.String composer
The composer(s) of the recording.

album

public java.lang.String album
The name of the album that the recording belongs to.

disc_number

public int disc_number
The disc number of the album that the recording belongs to. Only relevant for multi-disc albums. Set to 1 by default if information is not specified.

discs_in_set

public int discs_in_set
The total number of discs in a mult-disc album. Set to 1 by default if information is not specified.

track_number

public int track_number
The track number of the recording on the album that it belongs to.

total_tracks

public int total_tracks
The total number of tracks in the album that the recording belongs to.

compilation

public int compilation
Whether or not the album is a compilation album. A value of +1 corresponds to true, 0 to false and -1 to unknown. If this is acquired from parsing the ID3 tags, of an MP3, it is set to true if the file path of the file includes the substring "Compilations".

year

public int year
The year that the recording was recorded.

genres

public java.lang.String[] genres
The genre(s) of the recording. The genres field of ID3 or iTunes XML is interpereted by assuming that any occurences of " + " are meant to separate multiple genre, and these are parsed into separate entries in the genres array.

duration

public long duration
The length in seconds of the recording.

comments

public java.lang.String comments
Any comments associated with the recording.

bit_rate

public int bit_rate
The bit rate of the recording.

is_copy_protected

public int is_copy_protected
Set to 1 if the recording is copy protected, 0 if it is not and -1 if this informatino is not known.

from_iTunes_XML

public boolean from_iTunes_XML
True if metadata was acquired from iTunes XML.

from_id3

public boolean from_id3
True if metadata was acquired from the ID3 tag of an MP3.

date_added

public java.util.Date date_added
The date that the recording was added to the database. Set to the date when an object of this class is constructed by default, but is set to the date noted in an iTunes XML file if such information is available.

public RecordingMetaData(java.io.File mp3_file)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a new RecordingMetaData instance with fields initialized based on the ID3 tags of the given MP3 file.

Parameters:
mp3_file - An MP3 file to extract metadata from.
Throws:

Method Detail

extractMetaDataFromID3s

public static RecordingMetaData[] extractMetaDataFromID3s(java.io.File[] files,
                                                          java.lang.String[][] unparsable_files)
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
Extracts the ID3 metadata from the given array of MP3 files. Invalid files are noted and skipped.

Parameters:
files - The files to parse.
unparsable_files - An empty array of outer size 2. Used to store information about MP3 files that could not be parsed. The first dimension is filled with the paths of such files, and the second is filled with information on why they could not be parsed. Any information already stored in the passed array is overwritten. If all files could be parsed, then the two entries in the first dimension are set to null. This paramter may be null if this information is not desired.
Returns:
The metadata corresponding to each of the files. The original order is maintained. Null is returned if no files are given.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if no valid MP3 files could be parsed.

extractMetaDataFromiTunesXML

public static RecordingMetaData[] extractMetaDataFromiTunesXML(java.io.File file,
                                                               boolean mp3s_only)
                                                        throws java.lang.Exception
Extracts the metadata from the given iTunes XML file.

Parameters:
file - The file to parse.
mp3s_only - If this is true, then metadata corresponding to files that do not end in ".mp3" (case insensitive) are excluded from the returned results.
Returns:
The metadata extracted from the XML file. There is one entry for each recording referred to by the XML file. Null is returned if no valid recordings are found.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if there is a problem with the XML file.

exportRecordingMetaData

public static void exportRecordingMetaData(boolean to_arff,
                                           boolean to_ace,
                                           java.io.File iTunes_file,
                                           java.io.File mp3_directory,
                                           java.io.File save_file)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Extract metadata from the specified iTunes XML and/or MP3 files and export this information as a Weka ARFF or ACE XML file. No processing is applied to the metadata other than possibly the merging of metadata from the two possible sources if both are specified.

Parameters:
to_arff - Whether or not to export to a Weka ARFF file.
to_ace - Whether or not to export to an ACE XML file.
iTunes_file - A reference to an iTunes XML file. Ignored if this parameter is null.
mp3_directory - A reference to a directory holding MP3 files and/or subdirectories holding MP3 files. Ignored if this parameter is null.
save_file - The file to export to.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Throws an informative exception if there is a problem with the parameters or with parsing.

filterRecordings

public static RecordingMetaData[] filterRecordings(RecordingMetaData[] recordings,
                                                   int[] indexes)
Returns the subset of the given recordings specified in the given array of indexes.

Parameters:
recordings - The recordings to draw the subset from.
indexes - The inexes of the recordings in the recordings parameter that are to make up the subset.
Returns:
The subset.

haveIdenticalFields

public static boolean haveIdenticalFields(RecordingMetaData[] recordings,
                                          int field_identifier)
Checks whether all of the given recordings all have the same value for the specified field.

Parameters:
recordings - The recordigns to check.
field_identifier - Identifies the field to check. Must correspond to either TITLE_IDENTIFIER, ARTIST_IDENTIFIER, COMPOSER_IDENTIFIER or ALBUM_IDENTIFIER. GENRES_IDENTIFIER is NOT acceptable. Any value other than one of the acceptable codes will result in true being returned.
Returns:
Whether or not all given recordings have the same value for the specified field.

getTotalNumberOfTracks

public static int getTotalNumberOfTracks(RecordingMetaData[] these_recordings,
                                         int[] these_indexes)
Takes the given set of recording metadata, considers those recordings specified in the given these_indexes parameter (which should all correspond to recordings in the same album), and returns the total number of tracks in the album, or -1 if unknown, based on the metadata.

Note that if multi-volume albums are encountered, the cumulative total is returned.

Parameters:
these_recordings - Metada on a set or recordings.
these_indexes - Indexes of recordings in these_recordings that correspond to recordings belonging to the same album.
Returns:
The total number of tracks in the album, based on the total_tracks field(s) of these_recordings.

findNumberUniqueItems

public static int findNumberUniqueItems(int[] indexes,
                                        java.lang.String type,
                                        RecordingMetaData[] metadata)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
Finds the number of unique items (titles, composers, genres, artists or albums) in the subset of the given metadata specified by the given indexes.

Field values of null are not counted in the tallies. Also, any find/replace operations that have been performed are not reflected here for the purpose of determining uniqueness.

Parameters:
indexes - The indexes of metadata to consider.
type - A code detailing what field of metadata to consider. May be "titles", "composers", "genres", "artists", "albums" or "comments".
metadata - The metadata to search.
Returns:
How many unique items are present in the specified metadata subset.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if an invalid type is specified.

refersToSameFile

public boolean refersToSameFile(RecordingMetaData other_metadata)
Notes whether the the given RecordingMetaData refers to the same file (in its file_path field) as this one.

Parameters:
other_metadata - The RecordingMetaData to check to see if it refers to the same file.
Returns:
True if they both refer to the same file and false if they refer to different files or if one or both of the files don't have paths provided.

merge

public void merge(RecordingMetaData other_metadata)
Update the fields of this RecordingMetaData object with the metadata for the given RecordingMetaData object. The fields of this RecordingMetaData object are left unchanged unless they are unknown (i.e. have a vaule of null or -1). If a field is unknown, it is updated with the corresponding field of other_metadata.

If either RecordingMetaData object has a value of true for its from_iTunes_XML field, then this RecordingMetaData object will also be assigned a value of true for this field. The same is true for the from_id3 field.

With the exception of these two fields, all fields of this RecordingMetaData object default to their original values, even if they differ from the contents of other_metadata's fields.

Parameters:
other_metadata - The RecordingMetaData to update this RecordingMetaData's fields with

getDifferences

public java.lang.String[][] getDifferences(RecordingMetaData other_metadata,
                                           boolean translatecodes)
Compares this RecordingMetaData object with another and resturns a detailed list of the differences between the fields of the two objects.

Note that this method does not report diffreences in the following fields: date_added, from_iTunes_xml, from_id3 and is_copy_protected. Code is written to find these differences, but it is currently commented out because this method is typically used to compare an entry from an iTunes XML file with an MP3 file, and these fields will in general always differ.

Parameters:
other_metadata - The RecordingMetaData object whose fields are to be compared to this one's.
translatecodes - If this is true, then the entries in the returned array that are null or "-1" are translated to "unknown", entries that are "0" are translated to "false" and entries of "1" are translated to "true".
Returns:
The field be field differences between the two RecordingMetaData objectes. The dimensionality of the first index is equal to the number of fields that differ. If two fields are the same, then no entry is creaded. The second index always has a size of three. The first entry names the field that differs, the second shows the value of this object's fields and the third shows the value of the corresponding field in other_metadata. Null is returned if there are no differences.

getFormattedFieldContents

public java.lang.String[] getFormattedFieldContents(int index,
                                                    java.lang.String[][] headings)
Returns a string array whose entries contain the values for each field of this RecordingMetaData object. The contents are rephrased in some cases in order to make them more meaningful to viewers.

Parameters:
index - A number to fill the first entry of the returned array with.
headings - A dummy parameter that allows the calling method to access the heading names of each of the fields returned. An empty String[1][] should be passed to this array. The first entry of this array will be filled by this method with the corresponding title of each entry of the returned array.
Returns:
The formatted and interpereted values of this object's fields.

getPartialFormattedFieldContents

public java.lang.String[] getPartialFormattedFieldContents(int index,
                                                           java.lang.String[][] headings)
Returns a string array whose entries contain the values for selected fields of this RecordingMetaData object. The contents are rephrased in some cases in order to make them more meaningful to viewers.

Parameters:
index - A number to fill the first entry of the returned array with.
headings - A dummy parameter that allows the calling method to access the heading names of each of the fields returned. An empty String[1][] should be passed to this array. The first entry of this array will be filled by this method with the corresponding title of each entry of the returned array.
Returns:
The formatted and interpereted values of selected fields from this object.

printContents

public void printContents()
A debugging method that prints the metadata held by an object of this class to standard out.
